topics.name: What is an Operating System?
topics.explanation: An Operating System (OS) is system software that manages computer hardware and software resources and provides services for programs.
key_points: Acts as interface between user and hardware
topics.example: Windows, Linux, and macOS are examples of operating systems.

topics.name: Kernel vs User Mode
topics.explanation: Computers operate in two modes to ensure system protection.
key_points: Kernel mode has full hardware access
Prevents malicious programs from crashing the system
topics.example: System drivers run in kernel mode while applications run in user mode.

topics.name: System Calls
topics.explanation: System calls allow programs to request services from the operating system.
key_points: Interface between user programs and OS
Used for file operations and process control

topics.name: OS Architecture
topics.explanation: OS architecture defines how the operating system components are organized.
topics.example: Linux uses a monolithic kernel design.
